title.narrative: STITCH Middle East and North African Garment Workers Claim Their Rights - Mondiaal FNV

description.narrative: Activities related to Strengthening Workers voices in Middle East and North Africa. STITCH aims to create a ‘new normal’ for the textile and garment industry: a production chain in which textile workers, mainly women, can exert influence on their working conditions, and where gender equality, living wages, and fair prices, decent work become the standard. For this purpose, we will engage in constructive social dialogue between industrial stakeholders, and to achieve successful collective bargaining at factory, national or sectoral level. We unite the most important players in the production chain.

title.narrative: Together for Change in the garment industry; Mondiaal FNV partner in consortium STITCH

title.narrative: Local partners and STITCH form coalitions with allies (e.g.: global unions, ILO, OECD, Dutch embassies) to drive lobby and advocacy efforts for `the new normal` in the global garment industry
Number of common positions and joint statements submitted for policies, laws or guiding principles on main Lobby and Advocacy goals/strategies

description.narrative: Any formal joint statements or common positions shared by STITCH with outside stakeholders as part of lobby and advocacy efforts. This is a joint activity indicator (with contributions from multiple STITCH partners), and is only reported by this STITCH partner to avoid double counting

comment.narrative: (1) Statements and advocay campaigns for ratification of ILO Convention C190, and GBV + inclusion of women activists in the process + visibility and communication, including male leaders` endorsement; (2) Joint activities and statements with TUs / LROs, women feminsit activists and women rights CSO sthroughout the `16 days of activism` at the unions` level and in the media
